AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Mexico border: country border relevant to the smuggling context, where roving Border Patrol stops are governed by a standard requiring specific articulable facts and rational inferences
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Big Bend area: rural area with limited traffic, mostly used by local residents and workers, where vehicles with out-of-town registrations raised suspicions, frequently used as a smuggling route
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Farm-to-Market Road 2050: rural road where Agent Trevino initiated a stop, known for smuggling activity and limited traffic, considered in reasonable suspicion analysis along with other factors such as proximity to the border and usual traffic patterns
